Reviews.Title: “Not very good, lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: Pampered G
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Big Cedar. I wanted to try this place because it is closer to Branson activities. DO NOT GO THERE!!! We have accessibility issues and it is not up to standard. The parking space is not by my room...they have NO luggage carts. I had to wait for the "maintenance man" to help me unload my stuff. I cook all my meals there so I had lots of heavy groceries along with cooking utensils. Then, the hot water was only warm at best.They give you a jetted tub but you can't get the water hot. :( Then, the dishwasher wouldn't work AFTER I cooked a meal. Doors wont close and the tub is falling apart. There was a dirty pan ( used) inside the oven. The TV just turns itself off for no reason. There are no luggage tables to put yours suitcase on... Really? U get those at motel 6! lol... I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: RollingAlong2011
Reviews.Content: The effeciency rooms at this resort are small but cozy. The grounds are well kept and all the staff are very friendly. This is a nice resort off the strip and it is pleasantly quiet. The mini kitchen was stocked with everything you need. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms! Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sixhills
Reviews.Content: Very nice place - the rooms are very spacious - loved the open floorplans. Plenty of room in the kitchen to bring and store lots of food. Our kids enjoyed the nice little mini golf course, and playing shuffle board, and everything is centrally located around the clubhouse - so it was all there in one area. Pool area is nicle; however my kids had one complaint- the depth in both pools was only 4 feet. Not a problem for me - was great for cooling off while lounging by the pool, but they wanted to jump and dive, etc and got bored of the pool pretty quickly. There was an outdoor hottub next to the pool. No indoor hottub, but we used our in-room jacuzzi, which was a very nice one, located in the master BR. Now - here is the BEST part of the whole trip: We checked out of our unit and went to spend our last few hours at Silver Dollar City before heading home. As we were headed out of town, we realized that we had left behind an ipod touch in the room (we figured out that it had fallen down into the crack of the couch). My husband said we would never see it again - but I called the front desk, she took my number to call me back after checking with housekeeping. We decided to drive back to the resort to see if they would let us check ourselves, since we thought we knew what happened to it. Very pessimisticly, we entered the front lobby, began explaining our story ..... and the lady was grinning and very slowly lifted her hand .... holding my pink ipod!! Housekeeping had found it, and had actually returned it!! I was so very pround of that housekeeping lady at that point - she could have easily kept it herself, as it was worth several hundred dollars. Kudos to The Falls Village for having honest housekeeping staff. That is the best amenity ever!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Cjordon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom condo from August 1-3. We had a fabulous stay! Our room was perfect and all the activities they offered were just enough to keep our kids happy! We highly recommend. The resort is also in a perfect location. You feel like you're a long ways from town because its so quiet but you actually are a short drive from anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Bluegreen property.”
Reviews.Author: transitmechanic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 20th through the 27th, 2012. We were allowed to check in early, the property and room were very clean and well kept. The indoor pool, kiddie pool, and hot tub were closed a good majority of the time. The outdoor pool was perfect for children as at the deepest point it was only 4ft. The location of the resort was well situated, it was far enough removed from town to be quiet, yet you could be in the middle of traffic in about 3 minutes. We prefer to stay at Big Cedar Wilderness club, but this was a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: We are staying with family here at the resort. So not sure about value for the price etc, since we are not paying for our stay. We are staying in a two bedroom condo, it has a balcony, two bathrooms, sleeps 8, a big dining table, and is very roomy. The outdoor pool was a good size (even with a lot of kids in it!), and the indoor one features a "kiddie pool" too (though it was closed). And I do have to mention that the pools are around 3 ft deep. Great for kids, not ideal for adults. I noticed a pool table, sauna, basketball court, and put put golf too, though we haven't gotten a chance to use it yet. The condos are set up like regular apartment buildings and there isn't a lot of insulation against noise (especially above) and it gets kind of loud, also, if you don't get a "walk in" level you have to lug your stuff up or down stairs (which would not be an easy task for a four person family staying more than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: cntrydancetwinmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed here last week and we were really very happy overall. We had the combined one bedroom and one studio unit which made it what they call a "two bedroom combined" unit. We also had another one bedroom for my parents to stay in. The two bedroom worked out very well for my family. We were really very comfortable there and felt at home. We don't mind having a kitchen and buying food to make ourselves as this helps reduce the cost of eating in restaurants all the time. It can also be more relaxing at times. Despite the kitchen area of our room smelling of bacon the first two days, the rooms were all very clean and comfortable. The pool areas were wonderful and we wish we had the opportunity to partake in the miniature golf and horseshoes but were just too busy for it all! The only drawback was that the staff was not very friendly and hospitable. We felt that the "Concierge" desk people were very unfriendly and were just interested in signing you up for a meeting so that we would buy more points to our ownership. (we are Bluegreen owners and love being owners....this location was an exception to the service we usually get) We usually are made to feel welcome and the staff usually goes out of their way to talk with you and make you feel comfortable. It was the exact opposite here and some training would be beneficial. As long as we avoided the staff at this location, we had a very nice time here.

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly impressed”
Reviews.Author: jvawter
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few days here with BlueGreen and were not at all impressed with them as an organization. We were told at Big Cedar (south of Branson) that 2pm is no problem for check in if you just ask. We called and asked at 10:30 and were told they'd do their best. We showed up at 2:30 and were told that they would do what they could. During the check in/concierge briefing, we brought up the Big Cedar salesman's comment and were told that since they had our cell phone the concierge was sure we'd be called any minute. We finally got in at 3:30. 60 minutes later is not "any minute." My point to this is, if you are not going to do something special for a customer, don't make them believe that you are. Just say "No. That's not our policy". Don't give a sense of false hope on the assumption that when the customer calls back all ticked off, *you* won't have to deal with them. Anyway, on to the actual resort. The 2 bedroom unit was nice but there were enough things broken that made me question the quality of the place. i.e. three lights burnt out, toilet seat busted, dirt in the corners, etc. Plus the fact that they allow smoking on the property pretty much ruins everything for me personally. Sitting out on the deck in the morning? Nope... smokers. Playing mini-golf? Nope. Smokers. The mini-golf was very easy but it's nice to not have to worry about hitting into water hazards or things like that. The outdoor pool is small and usually crowded with kids so if you are looking to sit around the pool and relax, this isn't the place. Unless 25+ kids screaming is relaxing to you. The indoor pool was very cold. The kitchen was very nice and spacious as was the living area and the bedrooms are nice. The walls are definitely thin and you can feel every vibration from your neighbors. All in all, the accommodations are nice enough for a day or two but I wouldn't want to spend more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room”
Reviews.Author: D V
Reviews.Content: Over all the Falls is very good. The worst is the extremely uncomfortable furniture. Here we're three of us and none of could stand to sit for long on the sofa or chairs. The staff needs to be more educated in giving direction to get to the resort. The resort signs are broken, unlit and can only be seen coming from one direction sometimes. Being handicapped, in the club house area nothing is easy to access if walking is a problem. There isn't even close parking for check in with out long walks or steps.. They don't seem to get handicapp issues. Signage for the ticket office is so poor it is stupid! And again poor directions given by staff. Ticketing staff was great and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: NancyfromTN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for 3 nights in a two bedroom unit. The size was spacious and the area was very clean with a very well supplied kitchen. There were no elevators but accessing the third floor wasn't a problem. I attended the timeshare sales pitch but didn't find it pushy, actually, they were very helpful in answering my questions. There were plenty of activities for children from an indoor pool (and outdoor as well) to a playground to a nice 18 hole putt putt golf course which all ages can enjoy. The only drawback would be the very thin walls. People were quiet during the night time hours so the outside noise didn't pose much of an inconvenience. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pushy timeshare staff”
Reviews.Author: MissouriReviews
Reviews.Content: No means no, when your told no, we just want the show tickets we are promised, that means, cough up the tickets, and let us go. Don't force us to visit property and push a wheelchair up and down hills, when your told, no!! Oh, your prices for comparison, hotels on the strip are cheaper, and the food at restaurants is cheaper then your time shares!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Loud”
Reviews.Author: Yallahs
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a 2-bedroom condo. The larger side (side B) is spacious, but the smaller unit is small. The decor is outdated and the dark (dark green and navy blue). The condo was very dusty and not well kept. The ceiling fans and window coverings need cleaning. The kitchen utensils were also outdated and looked like they have had better days, The tv's were also outdated (no flat screen). We were on the top floor, but the walls were so thin, it appeared that the neighbors were walking above us, The walls are paper thin. The grounds were clean and the indoor poor area appeared to be clean (we did not use it), The check-in went well, but stay away from the timeshare sales, if offered, As usual, they get upset if you don't purchase. Overall, the location is good (away from the main highway and traffic), and has a nice view, but the resort could use a make over and a complete update (gut out everything and start over with vibrant colors and deep cleaning). As for the noise, I guess there is no remedy for that.

Reviews.Title: “Convient but Loud”
Reviews.Author: whereivebeen80
Reviews.Content: We are Bluegreen owners. I liked this resort except for the paper thin walls and cheesy furnishings. Everything was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Only "So-So" for Bluegreen Falls Village”
Reviews.Author: T48750
Reviews.Content: While our two bedroom unit was one of the largest that we have stayed in during our years with Bluegreen, this unit has paper thin walls and the ceiling-floor was so noisy that the guests above us with a couple of 5-6 year-old children sounded like of herd of antelope bounding across the floor and constantly banging chairs on the floor...a sonic nightmare. Also, as an owner, I can hardly condone the poor maintenance, mostly bad caulk in bathrooms allowing water behind tiles and baseboards. And last, but not least, they actually charge you for wireless internet in the units. Motel 6 and Best Western (and most other chains) throw in the wireless along with the hot running water and towels. Bluegreen is not keeping up with the times nor keeping up with their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: The-Travelin-DC
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we stayed at Falls Village and it will be the last. I was so pleased the first two times, then there was this trip. All three times, we stayed in a studio. What you should know upfront is that there are two versions of studio rooms. One is a great room, with a King Bed, couch, small dining area, stove top, fairly good sized kitchen, large TV, and easy access to a laundry right outside the door. The other studio is a small, dinky room with a full size bed, a super small microwave that barely fits anything, a small tv, and that is about it. We have to call in advance to ask for access to a laundry, which means we have to haul our clothes all over the complex. If we want to cook, we have to go up to the clubhouse and use their kitchen. Since we were planning on saving money by cooking most of the meals for the week, it is even more disappointing. The time we will waste running up to the clubhouse any time we need to heat something up is a great way to ruin a meal. I am so disappointed in this studio. We reserved a year in advance and this is the best they could come up with? We were considering taking the timeshare tour, but I would NEVER purchase one from here knowing we could be stuck in a horrible room like the tiny studio. If you want a studio, run in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: anth1234
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice resort. They are going to try and sell you on there time shares and Caution the walls are paper thin!! You can hear everything going on in the rooms beside you! The room was nice great flat screen tv!! There was a small kitchen in our room. The service was nice. The pool had way to much clorine in it and needs to be updated. Overall was a nice stay but probably would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Norman_Sooner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our three teenage daughters at the Bluegreen Falls Village over a recent 4-day weekend (late October). We had one one-bedroom suite plus an adjoining studio room for the girls. The units we had shared a common entryway that also enclosed a utility closet with full-size washer-dryer. Our one-bedroom condo was clean and quite spacious and was obviously designed for access for those with disabilities and/or wheelchair use. The only 'cramped' area was the tiny corner-style shower stall in the master bath. Off-setting that was a huge two-person jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom. The furnishings in general were on the low-end side but functional with the exception of an extremely uncomfortable sofa (for sitting, at least - it was a sleeper-sofa). There was, however, a nice large flat-screen TV in the living area and a smaller one in the bedroom and the studio. The bathrooms and kitchen were clean and well-stocked (only one night's worth of coffee supplied, but we bought our own so that wasn't an issue). Kitchen was surprisingly well-appointed with coffee-maker, microwave, blender - the works! Refrigerator had an icemaker that worked well. Plenty of towels and extra toilet paper and such. Of course being a condo there was no daily maid service so you're using the same linens your entire stay, but so what? At the end of your stay you strip your own bed and pile your towels in the bathroom and take out the trash - a small price to pay IMO. Although the unit was a little difficult to locate, in the end it was a great location - far enough away from 'The Strip' to be nice and peaceful, but close enough to get to just about anything pretty easily. To give you an idea, it is on the south-west side of town just off of Hwy 165 and about a mile south of the 'Yellow Route' (Green Mtn. Dr.). There was a convenient Sonic just up the street, and also a little shopping mall that had a fantastic Japanese-style restaurant (Shogun Steak & Sushi - recommended!) and also a Shorty Small's just to the south. Just north on 165 is the Yellow Route, and a little further north is the Hwy 76 'Strip' - east to Branson proper and west to Silver Dollar City. So overall a very good location, depending on what you're there to do. My main complaint about this property besides the somewhat cheesy furnishing and spartan decor is the noise from adjoining rooms. We were on the lowest floor and could hear the slightest footsteps from the room above us. I'm sure the folks above weren't 'stomping around', but any walking around was heard loud and clear. Depending on how many people are in the room (I think I saw 5 people going in there once), it gets pretty noisy. Just be aware. And as someone else mentioned the heating & air unit wasn't exactly 'whisper quiet' - more like an airliner taking off. We used both the heat and the A/C while we were there and were able to stay comfortable - I'm sure being on the bottom floor helped in that regard. The complex also had other amenities that we didn't use during our stay, such as a mini-golf course, sports court, pool tables, playground, etc. Overall a nice place with lots of large trees/shade and as I said fairly secluded. I'd recommend this facility, with a caveat about the noise. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and dime”
Reviews.Author: limaestro1
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort last week and it was a little disappointing I was told at the beginning that there would be an 8 dollar per day charge for wifi. After about the 4th day a guest told me that if i went into the lobby there was no charge. Why couldn't that information be given upon arrival. I was also told there would be a 75 cent charge for each additional pack of coffee provided in the room. Also be prepared to carry your own luggage as there is no one to assist and if you are on the 2nd level no elevator. The walls are paper thin so if you get noisy neighbors you are out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & super accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: fireball92771
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in Branson for our wedding anniversary; we stayed at the Falls Village Resort in a 2 bedroom villa/condo which was all they had available at the time. It was a superb place to stay. The unit was like any condo; kitchen, 2 baths, dining area, living area, laundry room and two bedrooms. It was located just off the main drag in Branson... behind ShowGuns' Japanese Steakhouse. It was a quiet place...although the view wasn't so grand, the accomodations easily made up for it. The unit was very modern..including fireplace, large jacuzzi tub and large screen televisions in two different rooms. We were able to take in several late night shows and ten minutes later be in our room. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN COMFORTABLE BUT NICKEL DIME YOU”
Reviews.Author: marci477
Reviews.Content: The studio I was in was very nice. It was clean and comfortable. However, the resort (timeshare) nickel dimes you. Keep in mind this timeshare charges owners hundreds of dollars for taxes and maintenance fees for each week used per unit. Then they have the nerve to charge you for wifi at about $7.00 a day or $30.00 for 7 days per each device connected. Even the cheapest motel in Branson has it for free. Need to print out a airline boarding pass? No problem as long as you don't mind swiping your credit card and spending 35 cents a minute to do so in the club house. They have three free internet stations in the same club house but none connected to a printer. Regardless, I could not get online because it wouldn't accept my confirmation number as indicated. Need a second soap packet for the washer, no problem, it's just 75 cents and so on. I managed to avoid the sales team calling themselves the "concierge" when I checked in by walking out the door rather than "now please step over there and finish your check in and see the conceaire for your vacation package" Two left, but unanswered phone messages later from the so called concierge, they gave up. Other than irking me with the absurdity of how cheap they are the studio was nice, the grounds nice and the common areas clean. The staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: sunnymo05
Reviews.Content: Very nice condo, we had a one bedroom. We were pleased to find that extra toilet paper, towels and washclothes had been provided, we stayed at another resort in Branson last year and had to go out and purchase extra toilet paper. The staff that handled our check were helpful and changed our condo from a lower level condo to one that we could walk right into due to my husband having some mobility difficulties. We will visit again, we had a great time at the pool and the condo was very comfortable and spaceous.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: taylarenay
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay here! VERY clean, great staff! Only complaint was there was no free wireless internet! You could use the computers in the lobby, but the wireless was ATT wifi and had to have a wifi account. Other than that, WONDERFUL PLACE! We had a corner apartment, A and B. Which is a Studio apartment attached to the one bedroom apartment. In the entrance way there was a shared laundry room with a full size washer and dryer! There was 4 adults, 2 teenagers, and 2 toddlers and there was PLENTY of room for everyone! The large table and open kitchen made a very spacious area. The jacuzzi tub was great! The decor was nice, sheets weren't softest I've ever had but not bad. Pool wasn't deep, but good sized. Hot tub was good and private. Free putt putt golf, steam room, and really nice workout room. Also tv, computers and pool table in the lobby! We will be going back SOON!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is NOT child friendly.”
Reviews.Author: toto077
Reviews.Content: We are Bluegreen owners. Our original purchase was at Big Cedar and that is the resort where we had intended using our points. Unfortunately it is next to impossible to get a reservation at Big Cedar so we were forced to stay in Branson at the Falls Village. We traveled with our son and his wife and 3 children ages10, 5 and 4. As always they were looking forward to a lot of pool time. The pool was extremely cold and when we asked if the temperature could be increased I was told "we have to keep it no more than 81 degrees, because when we had it warmer it was causing damage to the pool room". The kids spent about 5 minutes in the pool and about 5 minutes in the "hot tub" which was the temperature of bathwater. I was in the water in both areas and can speak from experience. We were ask to attend the "informative session" the next morning and were offered gift money to attend. I declinded firmly. Never the less we were disturbed at 9AM the next morning with a phone call offering more money if we would attend. We still declined. At 9:50 PM we received a call from the front desk that there had been a complaint about too much noise. We had a suite under us and also over us. When we made the reservation they asked how many children were with us. This is what we were doing at the time they called us. The 4 adults were sitting at the table speaking in normal tones, the TV was off. We do not drink, so alcohol was not involved. The children were in the floor playing with stuffed toys and playing hide and seek. Our shoes were off. Anyone who has been around 4 and 5 year olds know they run instead of walk and laugh . The problem is, the floors squeak every time you walk across the floor and the the walls vibrate every time you shut a door. We could hear the people up stairs too. My complaints are that the pool is too cold to use, the construction of the building is so shoddy that you can not avoid making noise. They should assign families to lower floors if they are not going to be tolerant of normal child noise. We gave up our remaining points and left a day early so the kids could go have some fun.

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: traveling4StLouiis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights using our Bluegreen points and hate that we hadn't used them before. Condo was very clean and fully stocked. We had the two-bedroom but only got to use the 1-bedroom because our kids couldn't come this time. The resort was quick and easy to get in and check-out, close to the strip and several nearby restaurants. I have absolutely no complaints. *Also checked out the grounds of Big Cedar- stunning. That will be our next Bluegreen visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clarkpartyof4
Reviews.Content: This place was A LOT better than we had expected. Blue Green has some really nice resorts out there and this is one of many. We had a two-bedroom combined. I traveled with my husband, son (12), daughter (10), aunt and uncle. Our room was fantastic and very roomy. We had a screened in balcony that was super. We had a dining table that would seat 6 very easily, and also had 4 bar stools. My aunt and uncle shared the studio apartment that was very nice. They were very comfortable there with plenty of room and all the amenities you come to expect. The indoor pool was nice and pretty big. The 18-hole putt-putt was awesome and we played twice. They have a basketball court, shuffleboard, PS2s, and they also have a large outdoor pool, but it was closed. Their grounds are absolutely beautiful. I forgot to mention that there was a washer and dryer in the 1-bedroom unit. We just returned home last night, and I'm ready to go back already. If you are looking for a nice place to stay in Branson that is convenient to everything, this is the place for you. Don't hesitate, make your reservation today!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, and fun activities! Mini golf course was great!”
Reviews.Author: MsWis
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a little scared staying here after reading some other reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised! We stayed for one week in a one bedroom at The Falls Village. We had a view of the pool and it was very spacious, and clean. I love that we had a washer and dryer (shared with only 1 other family in the entrance) We were in building 26 on the ground level. I would recommend requesting buliding 25 or 26 as they are right next to the clubhouse,pool, and mini golf course. Staff here is very friendly. Lots of fun daily activities planned in the great room, such as arts and crafts, that our 2 yr. old realy enjoyed! The activity lady was very nice! Also lots to do at the resort itself. such as pool, playground, basketball, hot tub, swimming pool, indoor and outdoor. We are bluegreen owners and did our review in exchange for a $50 visa card. Well worth it. The lady that gave the review, although of course she tried to sell us more points, was very nice, and was not rude when we declined. We went to the Wax Museum, which we could have skipped, it was neat but pricey for only being in there for 25 mins or so. We also went to Ripley's which I really liked! Very interesting and neat if you like that sort of thing. By far our absolute favorite thing we did while in Branson was Ride the Ducks. It was very fun, our Captain, Captain Crunch was very friendly, funny, and outgoing, he really made the trip fun. He even gave the chance for anyone to drive the boat, our 2 yr. old did and loved it! I would highly recommend to Ride the Ducks while in Branson. Overall we had a great time! The Falls Village is a nice place, it is very peaceful, and had beautiful views, the staff is very friendly, and I would stay there again, and would recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: FourGreatKids
Reviews.Content: We loved the Falls Village: beautiful grounds with large, well maintained pool, mini golf (we played twice, during the day and at night) and nice pool table in the lounge area. The indoor pool is also very nice. We had a 2 bedroom unit that was very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ILfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Falls Village Resort and had wonderful accommodations. Check-in was a breeze. No high pressure talks to take a time share tour. ( We did not do this.) We had a 2 bedroom condo that had everything we needed. Best feature was the screened in balcony with a ceiling fan. We were actually able to sit out every day and enjoy the view even though it was 90 degrees every day. Our handicapped daughter had no problem going up and down the stairs as our room was on the second floor. Pool wonderful. Would have liked to been able to bring food and beverages into the pool area though. Mini golf by pool. BBQ areas nice at each building with picnic table. Cooked out 2 meals. Plenty of room for our family of 5. TV's and DVD players great. Could not rent DVD's on property. Had to find red box. Kids loved it. Beds comfortable. Quiet area. Convenient and off the strip, which gets unbelievably backed up with traffic!!!! Staff helpful in finding grocery store, food, etc upon arrival. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: FireWoodC12
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I will say that we were a little worried. That all changed once we arrived and checked in. We had a combined two bedroom that was great. The kids felt like they had their own pad, but always felt like we were together being the rooms were adjoining. We liked having the foyer that gave us access to both rooms, but was still private since you needed a key to just get in there. We were lucky to have a room that was on the walkin level so we didn't have to use the stairs. The on site ammenities were great. Had the choice of two pools which weren't ever really over crowded, and enjoyed the miniture golf course as well. The only downside to the pools was the depth. They were only 3-4 feet at any point in the entire pool. The staff was very helpful in telling us back ways to get around Branson as not having to drive on the strip in traffic all the time. The other reviews of parking though are correct. If we got back late from a show, we had to park at the far end of the lot away from our room. At least it wasn't somewhere else as the hills are very steep. The reviews of the furniture and counters in other posts, nothing like that found by us. The furniture and kitchens were in great shape. The only con we really had with our visit was the sounds of the sliding glass doors from the units around ours. Anytime someone went in or out, we knew about it. We thoroughly enjoyed our week there and look forward to going back for other visits.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: EandPStill
Reviews.Content: What a great facility! I was worried about earlier reviews regarding the worn furniture and bad counter tops. They must have done a little remodeling as our unit was beautiful. The furniture was in excellent shape as were all the counter tops. It was so spacious. We were traveling with a senior, three 20-somethings, one 8 month old and my husband and I. We got a two-bedroom combined large enough for 8 people. It was very, very clean. Staff were helpful and polite. There are two things I would recommend: 1) FREE internet in each unit, 2) an adult pool that is deeper than 4 ft.. But other than those things, it's a great place. We'll definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad for handicap people”
Reviews.Author: lawrenbauer
Reviews.Content: My sister who has a timeshare with bluegreen made reservations for a walk-in level room 4 months ago for our handicap mother, ended up getting the room above which my mother had trouble getting up the stairs , she ended up staying in bed the whole trip . There reservation stink,, The A/C unit was very loud in mine and my mothers room and we couldn't sleep,. Since we were on the top floor we had to tip toe as to not make any noise because the people below could here us.. They locked one room out because they made a mistake and thought we left the day before. Not enough parking spots, If you come back late at night, you might have to park way far away from your unit. I defiinetly not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...IF you don't mind noise!”
Reviews.Author: micfish3
Reviews.Content: The resort was very clean and the units were spacious and accomodating. The pool and recreation area was very nice. Overall, great place to vacation unless you enjoy getting peace and being able to sleep. We complained after the first night of listening to footsteps late in the night from the unit above us. We requested being moved but nothing was done. After the fourth day of listening to pretty much constant loud footsteps, children running and jumping, the ceiling light fixtures rattling when people were walking overhead, whirlpool above our bedroom running at 3:30 - 4:00 in the morning - we were finally given the option of moving to another unit but only after numerous calls of complaint to the front desk. By this time we were completely exhausted from lack of sleep and not able to enjoy daily activities with our children. The new unit we moved to was located adjacent to the pool area and the first night in that unit people were extremely loud outside of our unit until 1:00 sounding like spring break in Florida or something (somewhat better than 4:00 a.m. but still irritating). Management did nothing to quiet the revellers. Starting around 7:00 we got to listen to the nonstop clanking of the metal gate being shut leading in and out of the pool by staff and maintenance workers and then later by guests. So if you don't mind tolerating lots of noise and little sleep then this would be a fairly nice place to vacation. However, we would never recommend this resort to anybody else due to our experience which seriously made us just want to come back home. Also as a sidenote, there was a charge of $30 additional fee if you wanted wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...will go back!”
Reviews.Author: shmemories
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two studios with the sleeper couches since we had our two teen-agers and four of their friends. Rooms were very nice and clean. Staff was very nice and helpful. The kids enjoyed the mini golf. The pool was nice but only 4 feet so they didn't stay in it too long. They wish it was a little deeper. The kitchen was very well stocked with table setting for six as well as all the pots, pans, etc. If you are going to be cooking for many you may want to bring an extra saucepan. There is one large pot and one small saucepan, plus two skillets. The kitchen made our stay more affordable since we ate most of our meals in the room. It has a two burner stove top, a microwave and small refrigerator. The tv/dvd was a 28 or 32 inch. The girls and I watched the Academy Awards show while the guys played games. Our son brought his Wii from home and hooked it up. We went to the Ralph Foster Museum and the play Seussical the Musical at College of the Ozarks. The Museum is free to high school kids and younger and just $6 for adults. We spent two hours there. Very interesting...lots of Ozark history...music....guns....dolls...Kewpie exhibit.....birds and animals....etc. There is also a mill, fruitcake and jelly operation, and several other places to visit on campus. We will do some of them next time. I was able to visit the one bedroom model while there and will rent it next time. It is much, much bigger than the studio and has a 54 in TV as well as a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. It has a sleeper sofa and a full kitchen. It also has a porch to set out on, which the studio doesn't. We read some negative comments about towel deposits, extra laundry soap costing, etc. The pool towels had no deposit and I called and got more coffee, soap, etc for no charge. In fact, the front desk call me back to make sure they had been delivered and did I need anything else. As a BlueGreen Owner, I think the only thing one has to be cautious about is the sales pitches, etc. We originally went to visit on a Bass Pro special we got in the store. We kept saying no and were checking out when the offered us a Sampler Pack for a year. We would have never heard of it if we had said yes earlier. We tried out the sampler pack for a year and really enjoyed it. Then we purchased the lowest priced points 4000 every year. That way we don't have too high of maintanence fees. There are usually extra incentives if you buy up later too. We aren't doing that yet. They also have bonus time rentals that have allowed us to stay at places without using our points and the rates are great...like $59 for a studio. They just have to have rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mcook3
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Falls...friendly staff...ready to meet your needs. We were on a 7-day get-a-way...we enjoyed our large open-space living room with the excellent view, large screen TV, hugh bathroom (individual sinks), great King-sized bed, and for this trip, our kitchen (great amenities). Right outside the door, we had laundry facilities (washer & dryer). We highly recommend the Falls and when we return to Branson, want to stay at this location again. Royce & Melba Cook, Wichita, KS

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to visit”
Reviews.Author: lwkBranson_MO
Reviews.Content: Must admit I was a bit concerned about what Branson was really like, and staying at the time-share. Was very pleasantly surprised. Had a wonderful time. Shows were good, people very friendly, no high pressure to buy, car rental couldn't have been nicer, and College of the Ozarks is a gem. Maybe not a place I would go every year, but for sure will go back again. Had concerns about the Blue Green resort location, but it was really nice and people were very helpful. When I return to Branson would stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time in Branson and at Falls Village”
Reviews.Author: ArubaOwner
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Branson and Falls Village Resort and had a wonderful time. It was a little hot and humid (90's) all week so the air conditioned rooms were appreciated. The six of us (husband and I with 4 children ages 15, 13, 10 and 7) had 2 units that combined would sleep 8. The kitchen/living room area was huge. Our room had a king sized bed and a heart shaped whirlpool tub. The bathroom was also huge. The only thing I didn't like about the unit was that there were so many light switches all over the place - I never did figure the system out without trying them all to get the one I wanted. But that's a minor complaint. An issue that may affect some people is that the resort is quite spread out on a hill. It's quite a climb if you end up staying in a building unit that is at the bottom since the pool, office, etc is at the top. Because of my husband's bad knees, we always request a first floor unit whenever we stay places. I did the same this time not realizing that it was on such an incline. We should have asked for a second floor unit since that was level with the parking lot. First floor guests had to go down stairs to get to their units and third floor guests had to climb up stairs. (not sure if all the buildings are that way, but most that I observed were that way. I assume that if your building is on the top of the hill by the office, then the first floor units would be the ones with no stairs for access.) The "A" unit that my 3 daughters had to themselves was like a hotel room with the kitchenette and beds in the same area. Still nice though. It had a fold-out couch so could sleep 4 adults if needed, but would be crowded. The "A" and "B" units shared a washer and dryer in the foyer which really helped us a lot. I washed clothes the day before we left so when we got home I had less to do!! We only ate out one night while on vacation (I didn't mind cooking and eating in - it saved us a lot of money and we enjoyed cooking and eating as a family for once!). We bought a bunch of groceries at Jubilee and took picnic lunches with us when we went sight-seeing. If you have a large family like we do, I suggest bringing a larger frying pan. Between the two rooms, we shared some of the dishes and cooking items, but still could have used a larger sized fry pan. The resort has an indoor pool and hot tub as well as an outdoor pool and hot tub. Basketball, shuffleboard, playground and mini golf are a few other amenities. There is no daily maid service but you can request an exchange of towels mid week. The room has a vacuum, broom, etc to use as needed. If anyone has any questions about the resort or Branson, let me know. I have maps, driving tips and floor plans of the rooms aksmieja@centurytel.net Annette

Reviews.Title: “***Beware*** Falls Village Resort - Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: Born2Travel77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I signed up for a 2 night package at a BlueGreen Resort in Branson, MO. We signed up for this tour at BassPro. We were initially told we would tour Big Cedar Lodge, but when we received our confirmation letter it stated we would tour the Falls Village and would stay at the Radisson Hotel. I called the toll-free number to confirm our stay. A few weeks later I received another letter from BlueGreen stating they received our confirmation. However, after carefully examining the letter I noticed we were no longer staying at the Radisson, but the Grand Oaks Hotel. I called BlueGreen and they told me the Radisson no longer participates in their program (which I understand why now). We didn't want to stay at the Grand Oaks so I asked if the Clarion still participated with BlueGreen and was told they did. I was told by the BlueGreen rep that the Clarion would be calling me back within 48 hours to confirm our stay. I requested a king-bed and was told this would not be a problem. I allowed 72 hours to pass and received no calls from BlueGreen. I called them to confirm our stay at the Clarion and they told me we were not staying there that we had been upgraded to stay at the Falls Village Resort. I specifically asked if we would have a king-room and was told yes. Had I not contacted BlueGreen we would have tried to check-in at the Clarion and weren't even scheduled to stay there. Upon checking in at the Falls Village we got to our room and it was a full-size bed. I called the front desk and received their answering machine/voice mail and explained what happened and asked for them to return my call. I let one hour pass and no one returned my call. My husband and I then had to go back to the main lodge (during a tornado watch) and explain in person what happened. The front-desk told us her hands were tied that she couldn't put us in a king room. This was something done by BlueGreen's marketing department and she had no control over it. I explained to her that we were told we had a king room and she still told us she couldn't do anything about it. She said, "I can give you marketing's phone number and you can call them." She should have offered to call them for us, which my husband finally asked her to do and she acted put-out that she had to contact them. Forty-five minutes later marketing still could not change our room so we insisted they put us up at the Clarion. They put my husband on hold and came back and told him the Clarion didn't have any rooms available so I called the Clarion. Well, they did have rooms available, so BlueGreen lied to us. With this being said I would not stay at this property again, or purchase one of their time-shares. If you're looking for a time-share or rental property in Brason I suggest you check out Stonebridge. It's much nicer and the staff is there to make sure their guests are happy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good time”
Reviews.Author: gg2002
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a few places in Branson they are all about the same if they are in the same price range. They have a nice indoor pool and the miniature golf was something that no one else has had before, so it was enjoyed. Staff was friendly, room was clean, bathroom was nice no short showers and hot water was plentiful. Didn't see any bugs, that is always a plus, parking was good (right at your door), (note to those needing elevators this place has none, but we didn't mind). Was well located, not on the strip but just a hop and skip from it. Anything close to Walgreens is good isn't it (if you have small kids)! Would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Falls Village”
Reviews.Author: KrissyNebraska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Branson to see the lights at Silver Dollar City. Our room overlooked a creek. It was very relaxing to hear the sounds of the water running thru the creek. Super friendly staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Was Had By All”
Reviews.Author: mikeinok
Reviews.Content: We went down for the Labor Day weekend and had a wonderfule experience. Watch out for the traffic on Route 76. Stay on the other colored routes whenever possible. We booked a studio and found it to be everything that we could have wanted. The room was large and clean. The TV worked great and had our favorite channels (Sci-fi and Spike) plus and HBO channel. We had all the dishes and accesories that we needed to avoid the restaurants, except studios do not have an oven for baking cookies. We did, however, find a delicious cheese sampler at the Jubilee next to the Wal-Mart. We recommend this for the family or a couples getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: QCbulldog
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here and had a great time. Lots of things to do for the kids. Swimming pools (2), mini golf, shuffleboard, basketball, billiards, free PS2, sauna, weight room. etc. Area is well kept. Time share sales going on but they didn't bug us once all week. Resort is close to "the strip" and easy to get to. Big rooms with huge tubs and great kitchen. All in all a great place to spend a restfull vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: taylormadepaints
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Falls Village at least 4 or 5 times a year. We have never had a bad time. The staff always remembers me and my family. The rooms are always clean and the staff is quick to fix any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Falls Village resort wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Freebird46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 7 great nights at Falls Village Resort. Everything was spotless in the one bedroon suite. We loved everything about it. Plenty of towels, they changed our bed linens and kitchen had all the equiptment you needed to prepare a full meal. Grocery store only a few minutes away. Staff very friendly. We drove all the way from San Antonio and would stay there again. We are RCI members. Bluegreen rep. asked us if would attend a presentation. We declined and no one approched us again. Helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad But Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: mainecooncats
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd exchange with II. After our trip to a resort in Orlando, I now have something to compare to. When driving into the resort I didn't get the "WOW" impression I did when we drove into Marriott's Cypress Gardens. Branson is all big bumps of land with building everywhere. Twisty and winding roads could make the sensitive car sick quickly. We stayed in a big one bedroom. Had to brush away the cobwebs from the entrance. They did not pay attention to cleaning detail. The rooms were big, but some of the furniture was broken. The workers were very nice, and helped me find the place as roads are confusing. We were not impressed with the shows in Branson. Vegas is better. But we did enjoy the state parks and Dogwood Canyon. It was a good time to go as it wasn't very humid. There are no grocery stores close by and nothing to eat at the resort. Another plus for Marriott. The pools + putt putt golf was fine. Just not really impressed. Never did find the "Falls". I think it was on the sign. I had the impression is was by a stream or something.

Reviews.Title: “overall favorable”
Reviews.Author: aj52
Reviews.Content: A co-worker let me use her time share and I must say that overall, the stay was very nice. My granddaughter and I enjoyed the indoor pool, the hot tub, the minature golf and the playground several times during our stay. We stayed in a studio and for the most part were very comfortable and had a full size washer and dryer right outside our entry door for our use. Although the stay overall was very nice, there were a few things that I feel should be mentioned: 1.The parking was bad. They claim one vehicle per unit, but I feel they don't enforce this. There was not enough parking to accomodate being able to park near your unit. 2. The refrigerator in the unit I had would not keep things very cold, even though it was turned all the way up. 3. The carpets were very, very filthy. My granddaughter walked on them with her bare feet and we thought perhaps it was just from wearing sandels all day, so we washed her feet and not 10 minutes later, her feet were black as coal again. The carpets definitely need a deep cleaning or replaced.

HotelInfo.Name: Falls Village Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 200 Creekside Road, Branson, MO 65616
